meanings.definition: Adjective: showing poor taste or quality
meanings.sent1: The bright pink walls in the room looked tacky.
meanings.sent2: She thought the plastic flowers were tacky decorations.
meanings.sent3: The tacky outfit he wore to the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her tacky behavior at the event was like a neon sign of bad taste.
meanings.sent5: The tacky design of the website was unforgettable in its ugliness.

meanings.sent1: The tacky glue held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent2: His hands felt tacky after working with the adhesive tape.
meanings.sent3: The tacky substance on the floor made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent4: The tacky tape stuck to everything like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The tacky texture of the glue was like melted candy.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally stepped on the tacky on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The painter used a brush to apply the tacky to the wall.
meanings.sent3: The tacky on the table made the papers stick together.
meanings.sent4: The tacky on his hands made it hard to open the door.
meanings.sent5: The tacky smelled like sweet honey in the jar.
